Reviews.Title: “confusing and unpleasant stay at casa pisani”
Reviews.Author: karen k
Reviews.Content: Booked in at the Locanda Canal only to be met by a young man who told us we were 'transferred' to the sister hotel -Casa Pisani!No Reception and no one on site so be warned- very difficult if things go wrong! The electricity failed in our room on the second day! Despite being told by the young man that we could ring on the i'n house' phone to communicate at any time this service did not work and eventually we managed to contact someone on the number given via mobile! The gentleman was adamant that Casa Pisani was nothing to do with Locanda Canal, despite me saying this was the number I had been given...eventually when he realised I was telling him that we had no electric(it was night time!) he said he would come over...We were so pleased to see him, but i'm afraid his attitude was aggressivley unfriendly.It took some while for him to locate the fault but again we were so pleased he did!! Thinking nothing more could go wrong we were amazed to be met by open unfriendliness from the lady serving the extremely inadequate breakfast the next morning!! We had offered no complaint and were genuinely pleased somone had come to sort the problem out but I'm afraid the attitude of this lady quite spoilt our stay.I would definitely not recommend-by the last day we were being served small hard slices of bread-tea and coffee were undrinkable!

Reviews.Title: “Visit march 2012”
Reviews.Author: Linda A
Reviews.Content: The hotel is compact but very nice and totally suited our needs. Staff were friendly and the young man on the reception at the sister hotel spoke excellent english and was very helpful. Breakfast is cold continental and perfectly adequate. As there are no tea/ coffee making facilities I would advise to take your own heating element. Nearest stop from the airport is fondamenta nova on the red line. Literally turn left from this stop, go over a couple of bridges, turn right by the hospital down fondamenta del mecanti, straight line across the square as far as you can go, (with the horse statue on your left) then turn right over the 2nd small bridge into calle de erbe. Its about 200 yds on the left. Fantastic osteria called "protega" about 5 mins away. Gets very busy, so may need to book!

Reviews.Title: “Large room with wonderful view of typical canal!”
Reviews.Author: kartul
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our teenagers, and had a so called junior suite, which was a large room with a double bed, a sofa bed and an extra bed. There was still enough room in the room to move around, but the extra bed was a bit short for our son. The room had two large windows facing a canal with lots of gondolas and other boats passing by. It was really nice to sit in the window and watch the boats. There was a fridge with some minibar items, but with enough room to keep our own drinks cool. The bathroom was very nice and clean. We enjoyed our stay very much, but as mentioned by some other reviewers the breakfast room was very small. If many guests would like to have breakfast at the same time there might be problems. However, during our stay that problem did not occur. Breakfast was quite good for Italian standards. There is no one in the reception but there is a sister hotel five minutes walk away, and on our arrival staff arrived in five minutes. On our arrival day we could leave our luggage in the hotel, but when we wanted to collect it noone answered the buzzer. I walked to the other hotel where I was told that I just should ring the bell, which I had done. When I walked back it worked as it should. Instead of taking the vaporetto to Rialto on arrival, I would recommend going to fondamente Nove instead since it is much less crowded, and you can walk much more easily with your luggage even though the distance might be a bit longer.

Reviews.Title: “rick steve's goof”
Reviews.Author: biennalebooster
Reviews.Content: we arrived towards the end of our trip in italy, so we thought we understood reasonable expectations of service (towels, breakfast, second cups of hot liquids at breakfast). the casa pisani provided no services and were unpleasant bordering on hostile towards its guests at its one service, breakfast. each breakfast brought another unpleasant exchange with guests. if it weren't vacation, it would be almost a hoot to wonder what requests would be thwarted next. it reminded me of my student travels in hostels which seemed policed rather than administered. since this place is also difficult to locate, just as well to pass on it despite it's mention in rick steve's guide.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous room, excellent for a romantic stay, but no front desk or general hotel facitities”
Reviews.Author: gwenllianCymru
Reviews.Content: We had a junior suite, which was a large and beautiful room with a comfortable 4 poster bed, windows that looked out over the canal with gondolas passing by , damask fabric on the wall and a clean bathroom. however it is really an annexe of the locanda canal hotel, and there is no reception area . We had no problems with checking in, even though it was late at night, we rang the buzzer and someone came within about 5 minutes, and we were able to leave our bags there on our last day until departure time. however there is no staff there after breakfast/mid morning, so if you want help booking restaurants etc this is not the place for you. Also on our last day it rained torrentially, and it would have been nice to be able to go back to our hotel to change, sit and have a coffee etc, but as we had checked out that was not possible as there is no lounge area. these are not major problems and for me the quality of the room, the convenient central location and the relatively cheap price ( by Venice standards) made up for them, but it might not suit someone who needed more personal service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: hayal
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this beautiful B&B as a part of our honeymoon in May. The location is ideal, close to the centre but on a quiet part. We stayed in a junior suite which had two small balconies over the canal facing Casanova's palace! The room was large, had a four poster bed and was very nicely decorated. You did not see much of the staff as they are only there for a few hours of the day but they were friendly and helpful enough when you needed something. We were very pleased with our stay and we would stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Homeliness to enjoy”
Reviews.Author: voula33
Reviews.Content: For those who want to experience a cosy, homelike stay in Venice, Casa Pisani Canal is an excellent choice. We were 2 young couples who visited Venice on low season (February) for three nights. There is no room service or reception but hey!!! it is Venice....we knew where to go and what to see.... Call them when you arrive just to be sure that there is someone waiting for you to check in and give yourself 10 minutes to study your way to the hotel....it isnÂ´t difficult but narrow streets would stress you if unprepared. Excellent location, decent breakfast, very clean... What we mostly enjoyed was that the hotel was almost empty at that time and he had the impression that we were guests at a friendly italian family house.... A stay out of the ordinary and much better from many of the 4-5 star hotels we had stayed before. Stavroula, Panagiotis, Christina, George

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Chicago Flyer
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this small, off the beaten path hotel (I hesitate to call it a hotel since it has so few rooms). The rooms are clean - note that they are up one long flight of stairs and there is no elevator so if you have a lot of luggage, you may be in trouble. The rooms are clean and so nicely decorated. The location is not far (10 minutes) from San Marco but is off the beaten path and as a result is so quiet. Staff is only on-site until 13:00. So, if you arrive after, you will have to wait a few minutes for someone to arrive from the other location. You just buzz the front door and it will automatically go to the other location for someone to answer. Have a good map with you and print off the directions from the internet on how to get here since it is hidden. We found it without a problem but closely followed the directions. Also, don't be fooled by the advertised internet access. Tehre is a computer but you will not be given the password to use it - so you must have a staff member log in for you. But, since staff is only on-site part time, that is the only time you can use the machine (this is due to the Italian anti-terrorism laws that require a business to know who is using the computer and when they are). I would not hesitate to stay here at all again.

Reviews.Title: “Spot On”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. It's only 5 rooms, and no reception, and no staff (apart from breakfast and cleaning). If you want anyhting, or even get in you have to ring their sister hotel, and a chap comes round. N.B. Don't forget to take your mobile with you. Hotel is fine. Our room was newly appointed, and the breakfasts were good. It is only 10 minutes walk from Marks square, and 15 from the Rialto bridge. We couldn't really fault it. Cheers Martin Hammon

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: vinceo
Reviews.Content: casa pisani canal hotel is owned by the same person who owns Locanda Canal hotel. in fact you will check in at Locanda Canal. Make sure you insist on staying at Pisani. Only 5 rooms...but very luxurious....all new and newly decorated. Breakfast is included...standard cereal, pastries etc....done well. Donatella will be there to serve you....she speaks some English and is very helpful. Two of the rooms are actually on the canal....great view...wonderfully decorated. We stayed 4 nights....two without anyone else in the hotel. The owner gives you a key to open and close the place yourself....as in no one is on the property...not even employees. You have to walk several blocks from the water taxi drop point....Zaccaria....about a 60 minute ride from the airport.....but literally a block from Piazza San Marco. Because of the bridges over the canal ...walking from the water taxi to the hotel is cumbersome. If you travel light, you will have no problem, if you are carrying or rolling several bags, hire a porter at the water taxi stop. the hotel is located in a more residential area, so it is very quiet day and night. By the way....free internet useage. All in all...for several dollars less than most of the major hotels...and many other smaller properties....casa pisani canal is outstanding. It is more like a very luxurious Venitian home than a hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nee2
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband just returned from our trip to Italy. We had a gr8 experience at the Casa Pisani Canal. It is an excellent hotel at a decent price. Our room was spacious and had amazing furnishings. The bed and curtains were golden brocade. The walls were golden too and the bed was super soft. It all gave us a feeling of being some kind of Royalty!! The breakfast was good also. I could have a cafe` Latte everyday. The best thing of all is the bathroom. Firstly it is clean and looks brand new. Secondly the shower is a full body shower with a foot massager attached!! What more would you want!! Though it is a small hotel with just 5 rooms it is very well maintained. You might wanna learn a few words of Italian to communicate with the help in the breakfast room though, as they speak no English whatsoever. The free internet access is a boon specially to check train schedules and weather. Our room did not have a view of the canal but we toured the room with that view and it was out of this world. Not only the room was bigger with a canopy bed, the view was awesome with the gondolas floating by. Anyways we figured it was not worth the EUR 60 extra per night as we hardly stayed in the hotel during the day. I would give a big thumbs up to this one. This was our best hotel of all our 5 cities on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here fore two nights in November. I was quite pleased. The hotel is well appointed and very clean. There is an internet computer that you can use. Someone complained about the breakfast. I really can't. Its more than you get at a lot of places and its free. I had no problems with rancid milk or anything like that. There was also a note about the tour to Murano. I took it and I am glad that I did. I wouldn't worry too much about sales pressure. The Cenedese factory is so ungodly expensive ($600 for one glass) that no one staying in a hotel for 80 bucks could possibly be expected to buy anything there. Take the tour and enjoy it. The staff was very good and friendly. The hotel is nearby a lot of nice and inexpensive restaurants and a couple of grocery stores. The Fondamente Nove waterbus stop is more convenient than Rialto in my opinion. Only a couple of turns so you are less likely to get lost. One tip, check to see if the website you book it on allows you to pay in advance or only books the reservation. I thought I paid in advance and got charged on the way out. Turns out the hotel was right. But its one of those surprises you don't need.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: great place to stay. about 20 min walk from train station. the hotel personal are great people. Breakfast was good. A little hard to find in the dark, but the directions listed by hotel on the website are right on. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up tp this one!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I agree with everything said in the previous review. We left too early for breakfast though so can't comment about this. All that I can add is that the sign on the door is very small so watch carefully for it or you will wander around for awhile like we did, passing the door and not being aware. Also, there is free Internet access at a computer located in the breakfast room. Vey handy! A great pensionne in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great new pensione”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great new pensionne -- and a great value for the price.In fact, when we stayed here it was not yet listed on TripAdvisor.com. Our travel agent had heard of this gem and recommended it. It's the first time we've stayed somewhere not rated on TripAdvisor. Despite our reservatinons, we were very, very pleased.This small (5 room) hotel is in a former Palazio that has just been renovated. It's a short walk from St. Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge (5 min. each). Like many small hotels, it is hard to find initially, but the locals directed us. The directions on the hotel web site at least got us to the approximate area.The hotel is magnificently decorated. All of the walls of the b'fast and guest rooms were scrumptiously covered with beautiful Venetian fabrics. Our room (105) was a second floor room (as they all are) taht overlooked two canals. We enjoyed keeping the windows open and hearing the gondolas float by.The room had a marble floor, 10 or 11 foot ceilings and was very quiet. The fabrics that could be loosened to cover the windows allowed us to completely darken the room.There was a luscious French double bed with four posts and Venetian fabrics. The chandelier and scones were expensive Murano glass. The sitting area was nice and overlooked the canal.The satellite TV was small, but adequate. There was no alarm clock or clock radio.The bathroom was scrumptious. Nearly completely tiled and totally modern, it featured a toilet, bidet, single sink, hair dryer, heated towell rack and an incredible shower.The shower had a foot massage unit, a hand-held unit, and a six-nozzle European shower massage. The tub part of the shower unit was small, but adequate for one.The hotel staff were very helpful in orienting us. However, we have one complaint -- they pushed a local restaurant, which we found to be only average. The restaurant did give a small discount, but we suspected also gave the hotel a kick back.In addition, the staff tried to get us to take a "free boat" to the Murano glass factories. Most guide books we read do not recommend doing this, as the factory to which you are delivered places great sales pressure on you.Therefore, we felt the staff was more interested in their pocket than ours.The other negative for us, and what knocked our review from 5 to 4 stars was the breakfast. There was only one juice, one cereal, one milk and two pastry choices. On our first day, the milk was rancid. The coffee tasted like it was instant. If you need a hotel with a fabulous breakfast, this is NOT for you.Nevertheless, if you want a luscious, quiet-as-a-mouse room in a new hotel that is off the beaten path, yet close to everything, and is still a great value for the money (as everything in Venice is expensive), then this one's for you.We plan to return in the future and hope these minor complaints have been rectified by the small but gracious staff.

HotelInfo.Name: Casa Pisani Canal
HotelInfo.Address: Cannaregio 6105, 30131 Venice, Italy
